tasks.task: Go to the tractor and get on.
subtasks: Approach the tractor.
Open the tractor door.
Step onto the tractor seat.

tasks.task: Start the tractor.
subtasks: Press the start button or lever.

tasks.task: Check the dashboard.
subtasks: Look at the fuel gauge.
Examine the engine readings.

tasks.task: Attach the plow blade to the tractor.
subtasks: Walk to the plow blade.
Attach the tongue to the tractor.

tasks.task: Lower the plow blade onto the ground.
subtasks: Operate the hydraulics to lower the plow.

tasks.task: Drive the tractor forward.
subtasks: Steer the tractor forward.
Monitor the drag and adjust as needed.

tasks.task: Apply pressure with the plow.
subtasks: Push the plow into the ground.
Maintain appropriate depth and angle.

tasks.task: Monitor the tractor's speed and traction.
subtasks: Adjust throttle or gears as necessary.
Check tire pressure and traction.

tasks.task: Check the plow's operation periodically.
subtasks: Look for obstructions or need for adjustments.
Make any necessary adjustments to plow settings.

tasks.task: Turn the tractor and plow to the next row.
subtasks: Align the tractor with the next furrow.
Maneuver the plow around any obstacles.
Raise the plow blade off the ground.
Detach the plow from the tractor tongue.
Drag the plow blade to the shed.
Store the plow blade in the designated area.

I think that covers it. Let me make sure I haven’t missed any steps. Oh, thank you. Got it. Yeah, three "Thank you"s probably just part of the routine, maybe acknowledging the assistance in starting or in various stages. But the core is the tractor and plowing operation. Makes sense. So I'll structure the tasks with main headings (MAINTASK) and then the steps under each (SUBTASK). Let me try that quickly in my mind.

tasks.task: Go to the tractor and get on.
Start the tractor.
Check the dashboard.
Attach the plow blade to the tractor.
Lower the plow blade onto the ground.
Drive the tractor forward.
Apply pressure with the plow.
Monitor the tractor's speed and traction.
Check the plow's operation periodically.
Turn the tractor and plow to the next row.
Return the plow to the shed when done.
